intro: Atropis vilfoidea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish.
